newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks soften in early morning trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks soften in early morning trade.

text.p: Tokyo stocks softened in early morning trade on Wednesday, hurt by profit-taking after the previous day's sharp rally, brokers said.
After 14 minutes of trade, the 225-share Nikkei average was down 20.40 points or 0.10 percent at 20,160.52. June Nikkei futures fell 10 points to 20,180.
On Tuesday, the Nikkei average posted its second-largest point rise this calendar year and its highest closing level since December 17.
Brokers said the surge in the Nikkei 225 showed signs of overheating on technical charts, but investor demand remained firm.
